page.title: 12The Commuter's Day
page.content: Woken by the radio,6.45,current affairs,breakfast,drive to Leighton Buzzard,fast train to London,working, preparing for the day as Managing Director of a publishing company.It is nicest to live in the countryside but most such businesses are in London,near to the people we need to work with. First,a walk through the office to see the staff;then post and phone calls to authors,printers,shareholders,over- seas agents and,as Chairman of the School's Governors,to the Headteacher. Midmorning,a long meeting to decide about books to be commissioned,more phone calls,then a lunch meeting at a restaurant nearby.Afterwards,paperwork and accounts,short meetings,more calls. Leave by 6.00,work on the train,home at 7.15.Supper,feed the horses,9.00 TV News,work,read,talk,odd jobs,go to bed around 11.00.
